description: Buy the GOREWEAR R7 2in1 Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: R7 2in1 Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the GOREWEAR R7 2in1 Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Be careful, the size they offer is european.
American size is larger.
review.name: Wrong size

review.reviewBody: I have the Gore R5 short and loved it so much I bought a second. Based on that I tried the R7 and am unhappy with the decision. These are essentially bike shorts without the seatpad. The material over the spandex is so thin and tight that it leaves nothing to the imagination.  The waist pocket is too flimsy to carry anything of substance without bouncing either.  Also, if you?re a dude, these don?t offer much in the way of relief up front since the spandex is so tight - so long distances are not really an option in these shorts for me. If you like to run in spandex shorts with nothing over them and don?t need to use the pockets, these may be your shorts.
review.name: Not a good long distance short

review.reviewBody:
I saw these on sale and thought I?d try them out since I have gotten more into running. (Strava says I run about 100 miles a month)
I found the fit to be just a little tight, I?m a stockier build with bigger hips, if you?re a slimmer individual they?ll probably suite you well.
The material is very nice and lightweight. You won?t even notice the outer short is there while running.
My main reason for returning them though is the product description is wrong. It says it has 2 font pockets and 1 back pocket, when in reality it just has a very small back waist line pocket. I really like to listen to podcasts while I run and also just like having my phone for emergencies, so shorts that can?t hold a phone are kind of a deal breaker for me.
FYI, the Patagonia nine trails is so far my favorite running short I?ve found. Highly recommend those.
review.name: Product specs wrong
comment: Hi Todd, I work on the Product Content team here at BC. I just took a look at multiple of these in the warehouse and can verify that they DO also have the 2 front-hip stretch/stash pockets, as shown in our images. Reach out to our Gearheads if you are interested in giving them another shot!

name: R7 2in1 Short - Men's

hasVariant.name: Sauvie II Chelsea Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Bogs Sauvie II Chelsea Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sauvie II Chelsea Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Bogs Sauvie II Chelsea Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Rarely do I order a boot that gives me no blisters right out of the box. These are incredibly comfortable for walking and doing yard work. LOVE!!
review.name: FANTASTIC!!!

review.reviewBody: Very cute, lots of compliments. They're definitely better suited for skinny feet and skinny ankles, but I kept them and they're working well.
review.name: Fantastic high quality

review.reviewBody: The boots look great and fit well. The only improvement I can think of is that a slightly bigger strap in the back would facilitate getting them on better
review.name: Seem warm and waterproof

review.reviewBody: Don't know how I lived without these- They are perfect for gardening, dog walking in the rain, and attending kiddo sports on wet grass fields. The very light neoprene keeps my feet the perfect temperature and the fit is great with medium weight wool socks. They have stood up to some hard use and look new. Super easy to clean. Quality build and feel substantial. I'm so glad I spent the money for Bogs rather than getting a cheaper product.
review.name: Versatile!

review.reviewBody: The boots are well made and sturdy. Very good quality. However, the sizing is off. The toe box is very narrow. I have an average weight foot and generally wear medium width (average) shoes and boots comfortably with mid weight socks. I purchased size 10 in this boot. I've worn size nine Bogs muck boots for years with a bit too much room in the toe box. I'm still wearing them!
review.name: Toe box too narrow

review.reviewBody: Despite them being a bit challenging to slip over the bridges of my feet, I find that, once on, they're very comfortable and supportive, and I can work in my garden for hours in these boots. The foot bridge issue is likely unique to those in-between medium to wide width feet. Oh, they look great too.
review.name: Tight on bridge of foot but good garden boot

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and keeps feet warm. Tread is nice too
review.name: comfortable

review.reviewBody: Super easy to get into, super comfortable, waterproof and perfect for summer when you don't need tall Bogs!
review.name: The perfect Bog Boot for summer!

review.reviewBody: good construction as usual, but seems to run quite small compared to other Bogs I've bought, and other boots from other manufacturers. I will keep them and save for days when I can wear thin socks, but they are too small for my chore socks. Will probably keep buying Bogs in the smallest possible Men's styles for the width and room for cushy socks.
review.name: Good boot, runs small

review.reviewBody: I reviewed these boots earlier today after I wore them once. I added a star to my rating, as I found with the second wearing and a better pair of socks, they really do fit well. They do not slip and slide on wet grass like my Sloggers do, so that is another plus. However, there is still the problem with getting them on - I have a long handled shoe horn, and that is the only way to get them on. And both times I wore them, my socks are soaking wet. They are loose around the top, and rain poured in the first time, and the second time even the wetness from the grass migrated down to my socks. They are comfortable once on, but not dry on a wet day.
review.name: hard to get on

name: Sauvie II Chelsea Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
First, a word of caution: I ordered these in the medium size and thinking that with my small hands and women's road bike that is all I would need. And, eventually, I have found this to be true. But I was shocked at how small these looked at first. I doubt you have anything to lose by sizing up to a L or XL. I almost wonder why they make these in a medium but I guess without using a large pair I can't compare them.

These took some getting used to, even though I sometimes ride with pogies on my flat handlebar fat tire bike. However, once I got used to riding with these, I discovered that they really shine in certain circumstances. First, I must admit I don't like wearing lobster gloves when riding my drop bar road bike because I learned that I grip the breaks and press the shifters with exactly three fingers. Not two, not four, five is right out. Hence I typically wear a light glove so I can maintain some dexterity. A light glove is not enough for me when temperatures approach freezing. And bike commuting year-round in Wisconsin means there are plenty of sub-freezing days. Once I got used to the mitts, I was comfortable in a pair of light biking gloves down to about 15 degrees, which is when I switch to my fat bike (its disc brakes don't freeze up like my rim brakes do) and lobster gloves.

To my great delight, these mitts really, really shine in the wet and cold. I left the mitts at home the first morning I was planning to use them because they weren't as quick and intuitive to put on as I expected in my pre-coffee morning rush (I also needed the external cable mitts, which have a bit more going on). Biking without them when the temperature was in the 30s and raining, compared to biking with the mitts in the same conditions a week later showed me their worth. My hands froze in less than a mile without the mitts. With the mitts, my hands stayed both warm and dry. The neoprene does a great job of protecting your hands from rain, and the smaller space of the medium mitts traps a lot of heat around my hands. I wear them a lot now so that I can get by with just my lightweight gloves. 

About a month and a half into using them, I'm getting comfortable moving my hands in and out of the mitts to signal my direction, and installing/removing the mitts from my bike is quick and easy. Though I was initially frustrated with the size (couldn't return because I had already thrown away the tags in anticipation of how much I would like these) I would highly recommend these for bike commuters or bikers who get their rides in no matter the weather. They get five stars despite the size because they help me continue to enjoy bike commuting. Well done, Bar Mitts.
review.name: Shines in the wet and cold but size up

review.reviewBody:
I have difficulty with keeping my hands warm.   When I go skiing I need mittens when everyone else is wearing gloves.  Even using heavy winter cycling gloves or "lobster" mittens I was not comfortable in temps below 40F.  

So this was my latest attempt to find comfort.  Bingo!

These really to work.  It took about an hour of riding to get accustomed to them but they really are excellent.  One thing.  With them attached to the bike they catch the wind.  You will get blown around a bit.  Not a deal breaker but something to be aware of.  

Anyway, this has solved my Winter riding cold hands problem.
review.name: Problem Solved

review.reviewBody: I did not believe these things were as warm as advertised until I tried them.  I only use these for road rides below 30 F and wear my usual spring gloves (that would usually only be used for spring rides above 50 F).   My coldest so far was 14 F and I used only a medium weight glove and still sweat slightly.  No freezing fingers until I am warmed up any longer!  A little tough to handle in brisk cross winds but not terrible.  I wear a small/medium glove (7.5) and sized up to large for more room to place my hands in quickly.  The larger gap had no effect on warmth.  I can't imagine using the small. I have had them 3 seasons.  Simple straightforward design in strong material with no durability issues at all as far as I can tell.
review.name: Very very warm

name: Road Pogie Handlebar Mittens

review.reviewBody: Compared to my old pack (camelback), this Gregory pack is lighter weight with better distribution across my back and waist, easier to clean with a leakproof bladder, and has multiple zippered compartments to separate dog waste from my extra layers and snacks. My only negative comment is the magnet for the water hose does not hold the hose, but I am able to keep it in place with other straps.  Overall, I love this pack!!
review.name: Perfect pack!

review.reviewBody: Light weight backpack with all the features that is perfect for an all day hike.
review.name: Exactly what I am looking for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I switched packs recently and couldn’t be more happier. I love the side pockets and zipper pouch. This pack gives me more room than I had previously.
review.name: New fave pack

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the best day pack I have ever owned. I am a gear snob and am pretty picky, but this bag is IT for day hikes! I have been using another brand's hydration pack for hiking and mountain biking but this has immediately taken its place. 

There is ample room for layers and lunch in this pack. Not to mention the organizational pockets and the out outside bottle pockets that are great for quick access to items or additional beverages. Materials and construction of the bag are great quality and I can tell everything is going to hold up for years to come.

This is also my first experience with the Gregory hydration bladder and I have to say it's much easier to open and operate than my old one. 

The only negative to the pack is the waist belt does ride up a bit if you're wearing a shirt made of a slippery fabric. 

Although this was a #giftedproduct I would buy it again for myself and my friends!
review.name: Best Day Pack I Have Ever Owned!

name: Swift 16L H2O Hydration Pack - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the WTB Riddler TCS Light Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These have hundreds of holes in the sidewalls and will not hold air.  Both tires have the same issue.  I'm returning these.

700x37 with orange seal
review.name: Will not hold air

review.reviewBody: Bought two tires and one was defective with small holes in the sidewall. Customer service was fantastic and offered a complete credit for the entire shipment. It sounds like WTB has had some quality control issues. Replaced with a set of Maxxis Rambler tires.
review.name: Manufacturing Defect in Sidewall

review.reviewBody: Out of the box these tires installed more easily than any other tubeless tires I've mounted, which was a big plus, but upon seating I noticed one of the tires had a series of perforations in the sidewall.  Sealant was able to fill the holes and they seem to be holding air fine, but it makes me question their durability long term.  Have taken them out on one 25mi mixed surface ride and they felt great.  I just hope they hold up.
review.name: Great ride, questionable quality control

review.reviewBody:
The 700 x 45mm  tires make my salsa warbird so much more comfortable to ride.  Way less chatter in the washboards & I actually don't feel like I am going to die when braking or cornering in gravel.  Just hit a 30 mile gravel race and they worked amazing from road, to washboards, to just plan fun fast and flowing gravel roads. Felt confident letting it rip even on steep gravel turns at high speed.

The 2020 warbird came with terravali cannonballs 700x42and we did not get along.
review.name: Corner Confidence & Way Smoother Ride

review.reviewBody: Great tire with plenty of traction on the dirt, while still being able to peddle efficiently on the  pavement.  I've  taking it on everything from long gravel roads, to single track and  back to pavement.
review.name: Traction for miles

name: Riddler TCS Light Tubeless Tire

hasVariant.name: Reversible Grill/Griddle - 1 Burner System
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Reversible Grill/Griddle - 1 Burner System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great griddle, better than I expected. I would recommend.
review.name: Great griddle

review.reviewBody: Great quality, quite heavy, perfect fit. Checkout process was easy. Shipping was affordable and quick.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody:
There's not much to say about the griddle, in the end it's a piece of metal that does what it's supposed to do. 
It's easy to clean and maintain, the bacon and other food you cook come out very nicely cooked.
The only reason why it gets 4 stars it's mainly due to the fact that there are parts where it's hotter than others and it might cook things unevenly if you don't know where these are.
Overall, a good purchase that will last for years.
review.name: Great addition to the sidekick

review.reviewBody: This griddle cracked down the middle first time warming up to season on medium heat.
review.name: Piece of crap!!!
comment:
Hi Unhappy Customer,

We are very sorry for your inconvenience. Please contact support@campchef.com and we would love to make things right.

review.reviewBody: Bought the new style sidekick and really do not like it at all burnt everything cannot control temp so got griddle to use on sidekick and it is a little better able to control heat but not near as good as old sidekick.
review.name: Griddle

review.reviewBody: Used the griddle for the first time this weekend.  Very happy once I figured out the heat distribution from the 2 burner Camp Chef.  Paid attention to seasoning it before use and it paid off as it cleaned up good!
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody: Used on dozens of camping trips over 7+ years and honestly, I could easily feed 6-8 people with this thing. As a person who loves to camp and cook, my flat top griddle paired with a wok is all I need to cook just about everything. Heavy duty, easy to clean, even heat, and 10/10. Wish I had one in my kitchen!
review.name: Excellent piece of iron!

review.reviewBody: This is an indispensable tool for cooking for many. I used this to cook gyros for 200 folks with great success.  Heat dispersed well, and it stays hot for radiant heat and continuity. It gets hot so plan to sweat! If you cooking. A grease trap is offered as an accessory but should be standard. Grease will flow out and all over the leg of the stove/floor. Placed a cup in the provided hanging holder but the cup melted quickly. Also, a carrying bag should be standard.
review.name: Don’t hesitate to add this to your Kit.

review.reviewBody: Works great, easy to use and clean up fairly easy.
review.name: Love the griddle

review.reviewBody: This works perfectly for us! We can fit 4 burgers on the griddle no problem. It cooks well and cleans up nice. This has made our camp stove multi-purpose by allowing us to grill.
review.name: Great Griddle

name: Reversible Grill/Griddle - 1 Burner System

review.reviewBody: We all know what this is
review.name: A true friend

review.reviewBody: Used for short routes at the crag and for long alpine days. Friend is light, easy to place and remove, and the extendable sling is awesome! The coordination with BD colors/sizes is a nice touch. A solid workhorse/foundational piece for any rack (and at a better price than any other brand).

Wild country Friends are the best choice for the base of a solid rack. Light weight and durable a great starting point with desirable creature features while still keeping no frills ease of use at the forefront.
review.name: Great for a starting rack.

review.reviewBody: extendable slings are clutch when you're low on draws or just need a smidge more to length to help reduce drag
review.name: awesome

review.reviewBody: Apparently money can buy friends!
A must have for a well rounded trad rack!
review.name: I love friends

review.reviewBody: Can be depended on like a best friend. What more can be said about this stellar product? Great price and reliability for rock adventures.
review.name: Best Friend

review.reviewBody: Handle well, great spring action, place with smooth trigger movement, cool sling extension and learned the clip one strand and leave racking carabiner in both to make cleaning and reracking hassle free.
these friends are too notch, shares colors with black diamond so that's helpful if you rack up multiple brands. they bite very well and have extendable slings built in.
review.name: great cams

review.reviewBody: Picked this one up for the size , well made and the price is unbeatable.
review.name: you can buy friends!

review.reviewBody: Goggle clip snapped off before we even got to use it. It’s cheap plastic and the screw doesn’t even go in 1/4”. Other than that it seems okay but the fit and comfort could also be better. Will be upgrading it next season.
review.name: Good not great

review.reviewBody: This helmet is very round/wide compared to the Zoom Jr.  It is noticeably wider which makes for an awkward fit.  Could be good if your kid has a notoriously odd shaped head.
review.name: Odd size compared to other Smith Jr

review.reviewBody: Children's small was outrageously oversized. Doesn't fit well.
review.name: Sizing is terrible.

review.reviewBody: I got this helmet for my 3 year just a few weeks ago. Today he was going fast down the road and hit a pothole and went directly over the handlebars, face planting into the street. I was right behind him and he hit his face/head really hard.. I couldn’t believe it when I picked him up and he was completely fine!! Not even a scratch. The little lip of the front of the helmet took the hit and saved my son. Thank you Smith Optics for making quality helmets for kids.
review.name: This Helmet saved my son today

review.itemreviewed: AK GORE-TEX 2L Kimmy Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Burton AK 2L Kimmy bibs after having my first bebe. Unfortunately my other pants and bibs from other brands didn't accommodate my newly wider hips. After reading reviews and seeing other people commenting these were the only bibs that seemed to fit hips, knee braces, athletic or curvy builds, I decided to drop the money on a pair. I am 5'9 and 170 and purchased the size XL. According to the size chart the L would fit, but I wanted plenty of room for playing in the snow in addition to snowboarding. 
These bibs fully fit the bill. The XL is plenty roomy, but the material and cut is very flattering. Instead of looking too big or baggy, it has enough room for hips and then the legs just look like a nice relaxed fit pant. The hand of the fabric is everything you want in a shell. It is crisp but not stiff and it moves really well. They are pricey, but are fully worth it in my mind. I tend to be of the camp where I spend a bit more money once for the right piece and have it last for years instead of buying ok pieces you have to replace annually.
review.name: Great bibs

review.itemreviewed: AK GORE-TEX 2L Kimmy Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these bibs they are great quality and size is perfect. Only thing I don?t like is the back straps sometimes get twisted up when trying to tighten or only one side tightens easy, which can be annoying but otherwise love them
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: AK GORE-TEX 2L Kimmy Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I blew out my knee on the mountain 6 years ago and now have to wear an orthopedic brace when skiing. I have been wearing mens ski pants since, trouble getting women's pants over the brace. Finally a pair of pants made for a woman that go comfortably over my knee brace! I am excited to give them a shot in the snow - will update once I have worn them through the season!
review.name: Knee Brace

name: AK GORE-TEX 2L Kimmy Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Bought the 3XL jacket, this feels like an XL. I wouldn't say this was even Euro fit (which tens to run "trim-fit) but more like an Asian L or XL which is another level of trim. If you are into a super-tight fit or looking for a fit that is more akin to what you would find in Japan, Vietnam etc and struggle to find this sizing in North America,  this may work for you. Please consider this before buying something final sale. 

Otherwise the quality and build of this jacker is surprisingly nice.
review.name: Tighter than crocodiles jaw

review.reviewBody:
I usually wear 29w x 31l pants. The size small in these fit me perfectly. I’m 5’10” 145 lbs. 
I bought a second pair
review.name: Fit me very well

review.reviewBody: I ordered the size small after previously buying medium bibs from Duluth. These bibs run very small and are too small for me (size 30 waist, 30 inseam pants usually). I wish they made these bibs in medium so I could buy them. At this point I do not think it is worth me buying a size Large due to fear of them being too roomy.
review.name: Great bibs, but run very small

review.reviewBody: Nice and lightweight. Really like them.  I prefer my Carharts for cold weather and they are also a bit mor heavy duty.  These are really nice for the warmer temps.
review.name: Great overalls

review.reviewBody: I just got my new overalls and I'm stoked. They're very comfy, stretchy, and breathable. Of note, not sure why the website says they're "nylon," the tag inside says "98% cotton" which I think is better for breathability anyway.  I originally sized up after reading other reviews but found them a bit large. I went ahead and ordered my normal size (I'm a medium in everything) and they fit me much better. I am on the slimmer side, but I would not call myself skinny. For anyone not sure about sizing, I'd consider ordering two and returning one, then you'll be sure to get the right size for you.
review.name: Great! But I found them true to size.

review.reviewBody: The material is light and breathable, but still durable. Good for an outer layer in early spring or fall, and great in the summer days. Size is perfect if you get one size up.
review.name: Great buy

review.reviewBody: Not sure why there aren't more men's overalls out there designed for hiking and camping. Most men's overalls are made with cotton and that's no good. While it may breathe well, any outdoorsman knows that cotton doesn't dry quickly, and that is why it is not used in true adventure gear. The only other men's overalls I could find that use synthetic fibers (that aren't insulated for winter) are TrueWerk, and that brand insists on printing their obnoxious branding all over their straps as if you're wearing some sort of fashion underwear. I'm not trying to make a fashion statement when I'm out in the middle of friggin' nowhere. I almost gave up my search until I found these. Flylow really knocked it out of the park. The only thing is that they do run pretty small. I would normally be a medium in just about everything, but in these a large fit perfectly. Other than that these are perfect. I just hope they aren't a one off thing and Flylow continues to make them. Perhaps I should buy two just in case? I can already tell I'm gonna be wearing these things forever.
review.name: Fantastic! Best hiking overalls!!

review.reviewBody:
Ash is a great color. I get at least 5 compliments every time  I wear them. If you are a slim, stick to your normal size. If you have a more athletic build, need to size up. The L was too slim in the thighs and waist, so had to go XL.

I really like the Nylon canvas feel. It has plenty of stretch, not like like stiff denim from your childhood.

Flylow has a great product video on their site if you are on the fence :)
review.name: Always get compliments

name: Trailworks Bib - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody:
I used a Lifestraw metal bottle for a year, however I travel the world for months with only a 'personsl' size bag, and metal bottle requires too much space. So I purchased Lifestraw collapsible bottle, and the tiny filter is difficult to use.
Need a big filter with collapsible bottle.
review.name: Small filter, difficult water flow

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody: I used thos a few times in situations where I ram out of water on a long run. Was very helpful. Also, it's peace of mind.
review.name: Used it in emergency situations

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody: Unless the bottle is almost completely full, it is difficult to drink by squeezing or sucking. I ended up unscrewing the top to drink, which defeats the purpose of the filter.
review.name: Squeeze bottle

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody: Something is up with the plastic used for this bottle. I flushed it many times and could not get the plastic taste (and smell) out of it. After 9 days it still tastes like water sitting in a garden hose. Too bad because otherwise, the design is great.
review.name: Good Design -Terrible Taste

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody: I love the water's taste, design, and weight. The filter does clog quickly and reduces the use time. I now have to do a backflow after every use.
review.name: Taste of water great.

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody: Convenient and easy to use when you want safe drinking water.
review.name: Life Saver

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody:
I didn’t research it as well as I should have to know that I can’t just dip the bladder into a stream or spring on my Appalachian Trail hike and squeeze virus-laden water through this filter. My fault. And I hoped that the loops on the filter and cap were stronger for a carabiner. But, upon actually holding them, I didn’t want to trust them. 
So I decided this filter in a handheld water bottle is going to be good for making city/suburban tap water and rural well water taste much better to me. I may or may not hike with it again.
review.name: Not quite as expected

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody: great material, reasonable Size, durable Quality, A great item, I use it every day.
review.name: A great item, I am using it every day.

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody: Bought this for my son to take on an elk hunt and he loved it!
review.name: Awesome

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter
review.reviewBody: Wonderful …. Convenient in small size for purse or senior walker. Larger size just take with you in the car to sip on in between shopping stops. Keeps cool in refrigerator.
review.name: Lifestraw collapsible squeeze

name: Peak Series Collapsible Squeeze 1L Water Bottle with Filter

review.name: Great day bag

review.reviewBody: This bag is great for small daily excursions and carrying/organizing a minimal amount of items.
review.name: Great mini day pack

review.reviewBody: I wanted a day pack for hiking. Despite some reviews, this is the perfect size for me. Can fit two steel water bottles if I need to and food. The size pockets are def not big for even plastic and they're too small/tight for plastic. I love the details, the cord wrap, inside pockets etc. The straps are lightly padded which is great. Most bags of this size have no padding
review.name: My fav bag ever - PERFECT!

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for our day trips, love the bottle holders on each side. Overall convenient pack to have while out doing day adventures.
review.name: Everybody gets a bag! You get a bag! You get a bag

review.reviewBody: Great mini bag for when you don't need a full-size backpack. Good quality.
review.name: Perfect bag for mini trips and errands

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for me - fits my water bottle, snacks and small items (sunscreen, hand sanitizer, etc) with room to spare. Some people folks thought this bag was too small but this is exactly what I was looking for. Other bags this size have very thin fabric for arm straps - this is much more comfortable for the amount I'm carrying. It's slightly padded. I love the cord in the front to carry a light jacket. The pockets on the sides are too small for a water bottle (which I never carry on the sides since it can fall out if I bend over in other bags). It matches my duffel too - love it. I've been trying to find a mini backpack for hiking, everything I've had over the years have been sling bags which get uncomfortable after hours of hiking. So happy to have found this one!
review.name: Perfect backpack for a day hike.

review.reviewBody: Fits my iPad and AirPod max and few smaller items: key, wallet, medication etc. The side pockets would be better if they were mesh and could fit a water bottle. Design is same like the regular borealis.
review.name: Purse size backpack

name: Borealis Mini 10L Backpack

I highly recommend this and I look fwd to carrying it on my next trip!

review.reviewBody: I’ve had it for a couple weeks now and this is a great beanie. Very soft fabric as other reviewers have said. I’m a 7 1/8 size in hats and while comfortable, I can see why other reviewers may think it fits too snug. It doesn’t bother me but is slightly tighter fitting than other beanies I have. I also did get one very small snag (as another reviewer commented) BUT no one but me would notice. Overall I still feel like the soft fabric, size/depth and style are perfect. I bought the Heather Goat Gray color and really like its warmer gray color. Don’t overthink it and pick one up!
review.name: Great Beanie

review.reviewBody: Decent beanie for the price.  Like the goat patch.  Material on this one seems prone to getting snagged more than my beanies.  Could be a quality issue. Tighter fit than other beanies.
review.name: BC patch goat beanie

review.reviewBody: My husband and I both agree that our Patch Goat winter hats are the best we've ever owned. I am very particular about fabrics and how things feel and this hat is the best! Soft, comfortable and warm. Highly recommend!
review.name: Best in comfort and warmth!

review.reviewBody: Bought another. Went in sale. Worth 25. But 15bucks is a steal
review.name: Comfy quality earthy yellow color

review.reviewBody: Great quality product. Thick material, comfortable and well fitting . Plus I really like the goat logo!
review.name: Excellent Beanie

review.reviewBody: The beanie stretches big enough for my giant head without looking stretched or feeling restrictive. It can fit snugly over my ears or stay in place above them if it starts getting too warm. I've been growing out my hair and find some beanies are too loose and slip off due to longer hair. Not this one! The color selection is fantastic and the logo is a tasteful size.
review.name: Great Fit and Style

review.reviewBody: Idk what it is about this beanie, but EVERYONE is complimenting it. It’s such a cute fit. Also - NOT just a men’s beanie. I’m a woman and it looks great and is so cute.
review.name: So many compliments!

review.reviewBody: Huge shout out to Kayleen at the Warren Miller movie in Salt Lake for hooking me up with this adorable, soft, fits like a dream, covers my ears, love the color, would highly recommend Beanie!!! The fabric is simply amazing! So excited to wear it this winter. Thank you!!!
review.name: I found it!!

review.reviewBody: Just like the title says -- this beanie is cozy and cute! It's well made, out of a thick material, and fits snugly on my head. Most of my beanies will fall off if I go upside down (rock climber and aerialist here!), but this one stays put! Be warned my large headed friends, this might not be the beanie for you... but for me, as I prep for the upcoming winter season, I think I'm going to get one in every color!
review.name: Cozy and cute!

review.reviewBody: Hands down my favorite beanie! Only question is how many colors I will buy this season.
review.name: Favorite Beanie Back in New colors

name: Patch Goat Beanie

review.itemreviewed: Big Zip EVO Drink Tube Kit
review.reviewBody:
The replacement tube has been the absolute worst... The tube material is way too soft and it kinks constantly!

Things that have made it kink: 
-Being in a full pack and having some pressure against the bladder. 
-Making a turn from the top of my pack to the hose hole.
-Making a turn from where it exits my pack to the shoulder strap clip.

I just finished a 3 week hiking trip, and I had to stop and open up my bag to delicately re-arrange the hose repeatedly and just hope that it wouldn't kink again.

It was incredibly frustrating! I was already frustrated by the price of the replacement hose, and honestly this experience has destroyed any and all trust I had left in Platypus products. Not sure why they changed the hose material but it was a very bad idea.

The reason I replaced the hose in the first place was because the lever on the mouthpiece of my original one broke right away. That was some years ago, and I had been using the mouthpiece from some off brand bladder for years since I had to replace it in a pinch and couldn't get a replacement mouthpiece or hose in store anywhere. I was lucky that some off brand uses the same irregular hose size. It was incredibly inconvenient that I couldn't just grab a new mouthpiece from REI.

I hope this product team gets their act together someday, but honestly I'm not going to waste my money any more to find out.
review.name: Kinks all the time

review.itemreviewed: Big Zip EVO Drink Tube Kit
review.reviewBody: This hose is about 3" too short. I was looking for a regular hydration bladder hose for use with a backpack. There wasn't one. So I had to settle for this weird model with a quick connect in the middle of it. Whats the use of that?? Who knows. Just sell a hydration bladder hose that is full length with the quick connect at the END not the middle.
review.name: too short

review.itemreviewed: Big Zip EVO Drink Tube Kit
review.reviewBody: I couldn’t tell before I bought if it would work and it didn’t. The product naming didn’t quite match up. Or maybe there was some other way to install it?
review.name: Too short

review.itemreviewed: Big Zip EVO Drink Tube Kit
review.reviewBody: I had a 3l big zip LP for years, but the on/off valve got crushed so I got this new one. Its pretty crap. The prior model had a clip-in drink tube at the bottom which could swivel. This ensured that it didnt leak. The new one is just stuck on, and leaks in my pack. the new on/off valve is bulky and stiff, hard to turn on/off. And last but not least the new reservoir tastes of plastic. I’ve rinsed it out several times and refilled it and it still tastes disgusting.
review.name: Previous model was much better

review.itemreviewed: Big Zip EVO Drink Tube Kit
review.reviewBody: the new fast flow mouthpiece is Great! But there are no instructions for adding the included extension tube to the assembled tube which is much too short (and I'm only 5'6").
review.name: + and -

review.itemreviewed: Big Zip EVO Drink Tube Kit
review.reviewBody: I purchased two of these expecting to get the product depicted in the product image. The product I received is missing the female part of the quick release system and the bit of tubing connected to it - in other words, it is not a complete replacement for the Evo tube system. The image on the package is the same as the image on the website. Either someone is not assembling this SKU correctly or the marketing/advertising department isn't communicating effectively with the manufacturing department.
review.name: Misleading Description/Imagery

name: Big Zip EVO Drink Tube Kit

review.reviewBody: I travel quite a bit and with my recent foot pains I've been trying to find a good shoe for walking long periods of time.To date these have been the best so far.

review.reviewBody: Loving them so far. Can’t wait to keep using them!
review.name: Stylish, functional climbing shoes.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, stylish, and durable and for a good price
review.name: Well Done Shoes

review.reviewBody: I got these for my friend who has Size 11 feet in the wide side. After reading lots of reviews, we decided to size up and ultimately the size 13 fit him perfectly.
review.name: Awesome show!

review.reviewBody: I have US men 8. 5 Yonex tennis shoe that fit well. I got 8. 5 of this shoe and it was too small, so I had to get 9. Otherwise the shoe is great.
review.name: Runs small but works great

review.reviewBody: Really nice to fit in, good grip, break in easily. Very good for beginning to intermediate climbers. Highly recommended!
review.name: Men’s Momentum Climbing Shoes

review.reviewBody: Picked these up on sale as I started to get tired of renting and they're an immediate upgrade. Fits well, sticky on the wall, aggressive enough for at least the V4s I occasionally bumble through. A little bit tight on wider feet though.
review.name: Solid Starter Shoe

review.reviewBody: I was using these shoes at gym and decided to buy a pair. They are very good for gym climbing and a good pair for starters. Buy either a half or a full size above your regular shoe size.
review.name: Very good

review.reviewBody: If you are a beginner like me, its totally work, love them!
review.name: Love this climb shoes

review.reviewBody: This was a bday gift for me, I normally wear 12.5 US, but keeping in mind that climbing shoes should feel snug, downsized 0.5 and regret now. Build quality seems nice, overall rubber seems to be very sticky. Will now order another pair, but now size 13.5
review.name: Never wore them, but seems good

review.reviewBody: This is a great shoe. Super good for a beginner or all around gym or basic shoe.
review.name: Great all around shoe

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Great sleeping bag for all around use. Whether car camping or backpacking, this bag packs down well, has a great temperature range with the addition of their Thermo Gills and is 100% recyclable at the end of it's life!
review.name: Comfortable and Warm!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Overall, sleeping bag is very comfortable material. I camped 3 nights straight, when the weather was 85/60. Going to bed at night was boarderline uncomfortable,  but, this bag material really made it feel much better. The reason it is 3star.....Im an average size Man, 5'9" - 210lbs. I am a side sleeper, and toss and turn. This sleeping bag was very tight on my body. There was hardly no extra room inside, even to move my arms to a different position.  I felt pinned down inside it, fully zipped. Maybe this is the design to keep the material close to the body, so the body heat stays in....not sure, but it was uncomfortable at times.
review.name: Great Bag......Just TOO TIGHT!!
comment: The Forte does have a Classic Spoon™ shape that is tailored for weight shaving warmth. Thank you for leaving a review!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Got this bag for my husband at the same time I ordered the women's Forte bag. He is 6' and the regular was just long enough. He prefers to not have too much extra length by his feet. This bag kept him warm in low 40 degree weather.
review.name: Great bag to upgrade to from a basic bag.

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: I am 6’ 215lbs. I just spent 10 days camping out west in Montana with this bag. Several days had temps drop into the mid to low 40s. I actually stayed nice and cozy in this bag. Plenty of room and it packed up tight.
review.name: Perfect bag for bigger guys!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Awesome bag, very light, and comfortable, used it on a 2 night 3 days hike preparing for the AT in March of 24, this was a shakedown hike the bag is a keeper.
review.name: Awesome sleeping bag

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Very disappointed in this bag.. I suggest you keep shopping.
review.name: Zipper Crapped Out! w/in 5 months.
comment: Sorry to hear about your experience regarding your zipper! Our customer service team is more than happy to help facilitate a repair or replacement of the bag for you. We'll be in touch!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: I have used this bag down to about 42 degrees in a tent, while wearing base layer garments and been comfortable.  I especially appreciate the floating draft collar that I can wrap around my neck
review.name: Excellent side sleeper bag design

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: I just received the Forte 35 regular bag a couple of days ago.  I bought this bag to replace a Big Agnes bag I have had for several year.  I bought it based on several reviews I had read especially from bigger guys.  As excited as I was to receive this bag, I was disappointed.  The first thing that happened was one of the zippers on the gills got hung up.  (The bag came with them unzipped). It was so bad I thought I was going to have to call Nemo.  After about an hour I was able to get it unstuck.  Then secondly, I got in the bag to try it out and I couldn’t even zip it up all the way,   I am a big guy, I am 5’8” and weigh 250.  The problem was zipping it up around my shoulders and I am not broad shouldered.  Not sure what I am going to do.  I thought since this bag was a Spoon bag, it would have more room for turning over.  I like the feel of the bag and think it is a quality, just not sure I can use it.
review.name: Great Bag, Smaller Than Expected

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Upgraded to this for my third Appalachian hike and definitely felt the difference.
review.name: Amazing!!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: The forte gives you all of the necessary comforts while out in the wild
review.name: Love this bag

name: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic

review.reviewBody: These are awesome -- it's rare a ski with such a rad top sheet delivers on the slope, but these not only turn heads on the lift line, they help you have consistently fun runs in challenging conditions.  Definitely not a single quiver-ski for an Eastern US person like myself, but I've taken them out in Vermont mashed potatoes and had a blast.  They can definitely hold their own on groomers, but they love bull-dozing through soft snow, and floating in glades
review.name: Amazing wide ski for western powder and eastern crud

review.reviewBody: Beautiful top sheet, excited to use them this season
review.name: Wow

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Underwear is comfortable and washes well. The only reason my husband would not give them a 5 is the material of the tag is not soft. It's a plastic fabric that is scratchy and is not easy to remove without damaging the underwear. It is not softening with additional washings. For this reason, we will most likely not be a return customer. Please use a more pliable material for your product labels.
review.name: Hate the sewn in tags-only bad thing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'd buy them form him again, he'd buy them for himself, we're both completely sold on merino wardrobe, thanks Icebreaker!
review.name: Boyfriend looks great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have most of the colors, but the Geo Blue and Lazurite started to peel off in two spots on the gusset, the bottom of rear. And the Loden started to discolor in 2 small spots. The rest is perfect
review.name: I have most of the colors but three have quality issues

review.reviewBody: so disappointed with these. i expected more from icebreaker than lame greenwashing claims. instead, i got a pair of underwear that after a month the plasticy-elasticy coating that makes these stretchy started delaminating (always cold-water washed, hung to dry) and now, after a little over 6 months, has completely delaminated and shed its microplastic self into laundry wastewater. i'm not sure how "corespun" fabric delaminates into the droopy baggy mess these have become.
review.name: aren't "sustainable" things supposed to last?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I don't know when or how I got my first pair of these boxers.... but it was over 5 years ago. Now they're the only boxers I wear. Simply the best for all activities: Hiking, Biking, Climbing, Etc.
review.name: These are the best, and I can't go back

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the best underwear for adventures and long active days. I took a few pairs for a 16 day trip because I wanted something comfortable, lightweight, and that would stay fresh with minimal laundering. They were perfect. Highly recommended.
review.name: Fantastic

name: Anatomica Boxers - Men's

review.reviewBody: I ordered these gloves about a week before I needed them for a trip to the mountains, but I never received them. I paid a lot of extra money to expedite the shipping so I would get them in time, so should have gotten them within a couple of days. I only got an email that they were shipped right after I ordered them, and then I didn't receive any other updates at all. They did not arrive on time, and now it has been almost a month and I still don't have them. After spending way too much time contacting support they told me they didn't know what happened, but it looked like they were lost during shipping. They told me they could refund me or try sending a new pair. I took the refund.
review.name: Lost during shipping and never received
comment: Hi, we're sorry that these were lost on the way to you and we have issued a refund back to your original payment method. If you have any other questions or concerns please let us know.

review.reviewBody: Fits well. I went with large. Has nice dexterity. Did not work with my phone. ( it was cold out) Fits under my  softshel gloves . Kept my.hands warm while active. Not so well when I was resting.
review.name: Great liner gloves

name: Power Stretch Pro Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bottle is super cute, and the size is perfect! It’s light to carry and easy to fill, but I also drink all the water now! The straw is really handy and easy to clean! And the bottle is gorgeous! The only issue is that the straw sometimes spits water at me, and sometimes the bottle leaks out the top/straw, but not a big deal and I still love the bottle! This is my third Hydro flask and I will definitely be continuing to support them in the future!
review.name: Perfection! (As usual!)

review.reviewBody: Just noticed a lot of colors were half off…I bet if there was a pink option it would be sold out… just saying. help me help you<3

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these reels 2nd hand but still new in the box and it seems well made and is a nice looking reel. When I was setting it up the spring somehow bent so it doesn't engage the drag at all. I've reached out to Hardy multiple times over the past few weeks to try and get a replacement spring and have received no response from anyone. I'd love to give this reel a try and would certainly update my review if I get to fish it and it works but for now it's a very light paperweight on my tying desk. I'm assuming I just received it with a bad spring but I am concerned about durability given this issue before I even had a chance to fish with it.
review.name: Nice Reel, bad spring

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these beautifully made little reels for my 3 weight Hardy Ultralite ll and one for my 4 weight Sage Trout ll. I've caught some pretty big Brown, Rainbow Trout and Grayling on these reels and they performed perfectly. I love how light they are, it all adds to the joy of fishing lighter gear.
review.name: Excellent Reel - Highly Recommend

review.reviewBody: Hardy quality!!! need i say more, so light you even forget its there
review.name: So light

review.reviewBody: Paired the 5000 with a 0wt SPL. Couldn’t be happier with the balance. Fit and finish are fantastic. And the scream of the clicker when a fish is running will put a smile on your face.
review.name: Ultralight at its finest

name: Ultraclick Fly Reel

review.reviewBody: Like someone else said they wet out in LITERALLY 20 minutes. What a shame, wish i never wasted my money on this garbage, their stuff is usually great but not these shoe covers.
review.name: Don't waste your money.

review.reviewBody: Good luck getting this product in any configuration that will fit you. My wife and I ordered three sizes between us, hoping one would work. For me 2XL was the only choice but even that was too small to fit my lower calf, and I'm not that big a guy. The only way my wife could get the overshoe to fully zip was by pushing the cuff down every time she managed to zip it an inch at a time, essentially needing to bunch most of the top around her upper ankle. The sizing is comically poor. I usually love Castelli products but buyer beware here. Feel bad about burning more diesel fuel to return these rejects but no way would these ever work for us.
review.name: Laughable Sizing

review.reviewBody: Got soaked through in a moderate summer rain during a 20 min ride. Ridiculous. An abomination for a premium brand such as Castelli to make such an inefficient and worthless piece of kit for a relatively high price tag. I trashed them as I saw no use of them. No kidding.
review.name: Completely Useless

name: Pioggerella Shoecover

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have narrow feet but fit perfect for me. The grip is perfect for grass and mud and still fast when moving from the road
review.name: Amazing grip for a mix of trail and road

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: it fits long - suggest going 1/2 size down. otherwise apart from that really nice feel u see foot.
review.name: fits a little long, size down

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
very light shoes,but too tight toobox,
not waterproof version,
I hope adidas making wide fit as well
review.name: quality ok,size small

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
First the sizing is off.  I had to go down .5 a size and maybe I should have gone down a full size.   The shoe is very unstable.   I only want to wear it on buffed trails.   The back of the shoe is very hard and makes my heel hurt.   The arch feels like it is too far forward in the shoe and hits the bottom of my door weird. 
  But when I do wear them they are FAST.   Too bad there are so many reasons that makes wearing them hard.
review.name: Unstable and weird fit but fast

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my second pair, absolutely loved my first pair and now that they are nearing 1000km this second pair are for upcoming trail races. Brilliant fast and comfortable shoes which seem to have lasted really well. My only gripe is that they have always felt quite wide fitting for someone who prefers a B width and would love future iterations to be available in a narrower fit.
review.name: Best trail race shoes ever.

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Comfortable, fast and keeps you rolling through your stride. Great fun on the road as well.

Havnt tried any technical trails in them yet but for light trails/ parkruns and even road running they are a perfect all round shoe.

Already recommended to a friend and she purchased some straight away and also loved them!
review.name: The only trail shoe I’ve enjoyed wearing!

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After using my Boston 12s for a 100miler event I thought it would be worth investing in these. Great for what they are intended but can be a bit unstable on technical trail. I do struggle a bit to lock the heels in but it's no big deal
review.name: Would recommend

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Feels superfast, and so easy on the feet, even after long runs in the mountain.
review.name: Super shoe!

review.itemreviewed: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very supportive in the arch and when you walk it’s like your springing along. They have a fantastic grip on slippery surfaces.
review.name: Propelled Springs Underfoot

name: Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is a clever design for a very light and cool garment for hot days. Since my whole frame is broad compared to bust size, it hangs a little less than ideal on me; extra fabric up top. But I'll take a less than ideal fit in exchange for the utility. It doesn't look bad either. Bought it on sale, there's no way I would've gambled on it at the absurd full price, but I liked it so well I bought a second. I work in a food truck sometimes, and like to kayak, and this was great for both applications.
review.name: Useful Piece

review.reviewBody:
I loved the shorts version of these so much, I bought the jumpsuit in the same color! This material is incredible,  its so lightweight and breathable, but durable without being rigid. The green color is wonderful as its visible on the trail, but also so cute! Its better then more khaki, lol
The sizing on all  jumpsuits are always a little iffy on me, I usually size up one or two, and then get it altered to fit. It's worth the extra work, especially for something that will be worn and loved for years to come
review.name: Super Cute and Functional Jumpsuit

review.reviewBody: Best Quality pants for any activity. Useful number of pockets, I wear them for work and hiking into riding motorcycles and anything outdoors since it is quick dry. So good i had to buy a second pair in a different color.
review.name: Quality activity pants for play and work

review.reviewBody:
Super cute
I am 5’8” and 140lbs 
Small fits great
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody:
I LOVE this romper so much but cannot resolve how it fits on me. My top runs small and bigger on the bottom. I ordered the Medium and Small and none of them fits perfectly--they're either too baggy on the top or too tight on the bottom. So sad that I have to return! *Even with the cinch on the waist, it's still doesnt help much :(

I think it's best for people who have the same size top and bottom. They run true to size!
review.name: Not ideal for curvy

review.reviewBody: The fabric is very soft and stays cool in hot weather.  It also dries quickly when it gets wet.  I ordered a small and am 145 lbs and 5’5”- it fits fine but I possibly could have went with a medium to get a bit more length in the torso. The back is a cute feature and looks good with several different sports bras.
review.name: Super cute

review.reviewBody:
In short, this is so comfortable and functional. The shorts do not ride up. There was no need to adjustments after wearing around the house for 30 minutes. I have two toddlers and this is the year of camping for us. I can already tell I will living in this get up. I’m 5’8, 165 pounds, long torso with big athletic thighs, whose shoulders and DD chest. 

This would be awesome for climbing do to the length and fit of the shorts and also it has a the tell tale extra fabric in the tummy/ crotch area to allow for that. Because of that it’s not the most flattering. I’m 34 and wearing this camping so I don’t care. I will say that I bought the Back Country bra that the model is wearing and it was a no go for me. I think that wearing this with a cuter bra would help the cute factor if that’s what you want.
review.name: Comfy and Functional

name: Wasatch Ripstop Romper - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I bought this one for work and after couple of months start having a pain in my feet. Went to a doctor told me to change the shoes and pain stopped. It was good made shoes but not for me
review.name: Work shoes

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: The shoes are amazingly comfortable & we do some serious hiking but they are not waterproof! Even walk through grass with dew soaks through!
review.name: Not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Great hiking boots, could be my perfect hiking boot with a few changes. My family of 3 have worn Merrell hiking boots and winter boots for years. The Moab 2 are lightweight, keep your feet dry and warm and give you great traction. The only reason for docking a star is the foot bed. With this last pair, I have noticed that my toes feel so smashed in the upper part of the boot, both in width and length. I’ve worn an 8.5 since I was 16 but I may have to size up for my next pair. I don’t want my hiking boots to run large and feel floppy but these just feel uncomfortable after a a mile or two. I find myself thinking about taking them off which definitely ruins the purpose of my hike. I will possibly try a wide, but again, I don’t want anything to big to cause tripping. Merrell are great boots, this doesn’t make me want to switch brands, but I may have to switch styles to look for a better fit.
review.name: Toe box shrinking?

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: My 5 yr old loves these boots and wants to wear them everywhere. We normally wear minimalist footwear and these were his transition to an actual boot. Went with the wide boot to accommodate his wide feet and thicker socks for colder outings. Great traction and he says they are very comfortable. Have yet to test the waterproof capabilities.
review.name: Awesome Boot

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: They run small, so we ordered a size bigger,  and they hurt my daughters feet at the sides of her toes. She doesn’t have wide feet by any means.
review.name: Wish they worked

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Great shoos and boots. The most comfortable I've ever owned. They are the only shoes I buy anymore.
review.name: Most comfortable shoes ever.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody:
I wanted my 11yo daughter to be comfortable in good shoes for her hike. She didn't complain even once about her feet hurting (maybe her legs lol). We had rocky terrain, river crossings, and mud puddles. 
I will say these didn't seem to be very waterproof, but I had her wear thick socks and she was kept dry and comfortable.
review.name: Kiddo rocked her hiking shoes

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: These shoes keep your feet warm and dry in the snow. Now, when it comes to actual water, keeping your feet dry doesn’t last very long. So, durability is great! Waterproofing doesn’t last long.
review.name: Longevity
comment: We stand behind our products and we'd love the opportunity to help. Please give us a call at 800.288.3124 or live chat at Merrell.com.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: My 7 year old son loves them. We got them for hikes, but he wears them everywhere! He says they are very comfortable.
review.name: Great hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: The sole is a bit too stiff for my daughter especially compared to the first pair of chameleon hikers she had from merrel last summer that she out grew and I can’t find the style any more. The speed laces also seem cheap the have got snagged and bent three times already in less than a month i hope they don’t break off from being bent back into shape
review.name: A bit disappointed
comment: We value and appreciate your feedback. Please give us a call at 800-288-3124 if we can help. Thank you.

name: Moab 2 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'

description: Buy the 7mesh Industries MK3 Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MK3 Bib Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the 7mesh Industries MK3 Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
My favorite aspect of these bibs besides the simple straightforward aesthetic is the flat bib straps. Not only do they appear invisible once you put on a jersey, but they spread the tension so evenly they feel like they're not even there. Secondly, the flat leg "hem" on these shorts look as good as they feel! If I don't have to think about the gear I'm wearing, I can focus on my ride and enjoy myself. These bibs do exactly that.

The only reason I haven't marked them as a 5-star product is the inseam. A little short for my liking.
review.name: Sleek Bib Straps and Flat Hem

review.reviewBody: Was very surprised at how uncomfortable these bibs were. The chamois is fine, but nothing special feeling. The biggest problem are the seams on the back leg panels are down right abrasive. As a result I experience irritating chaffing and I only wear these out of rotation necessity and on rides less than 30miles. Another annoyance is the leg length is really long and bunches quite a bit.
review.name: Disappointed

name: MK3 Bib Short - Men's

review.itemreviewed: RX600 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve got a wide tow box. Not EE wide, but wide enough that finding comfortable, all-day clipless pedals is darn near impossible. My 7-year old Shimano mtb shoes are barely hanging in there(with many questionable repairs). I bought these…despite reviews that alluded to the shoes being at best a normal width. My mistake. They are somehow narrower than my old Shimano’s & totally unacceptable as a ‘wide’ shoe. PLEASE DO NOT BUY THESE IF YOU’RE SEARCHING FOR A WIDE SHOE. A quick post-purchase search of my local Craigslist revealed a half dozen pairs of these for sale for the same reason. C’mon Shimano!
review.name: Shame on Shimano

review.itemreviewed: RX600 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered this shoe in my normal size for athletic shoes, which is .5 larger than my street shoes and in a wide because of needing extra width in the toe box.  The wide size is shaped with a tapered toe box instead of a wide toe box, so I don't know what part of this shoe is considered wide.  The length was also short compared to other bike shoes.  I do not recommend.
review.name: Not Wide

name: RX600 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a four-day backpacking trip in Great Smoky Mountains National Park. I loved how it put the weight of the load to my hips instead of my shoulders. I liked the size and location of the side and hip pockets as they allow you to reach for water or snacks without stopping. The front hip belt straps were a little long and bounced against my legs but I just tied knots into them to shorten them. The brain was roomy and easy to access and let me get to things without digging all the way into the pack.
review.name: Great for a heavier load

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I would love to give this pack a good review, unfortunately, of the two sizes available, neither of them fit me. With a 19-1/2" torso, I fall somewhere between the two sizes. When I follow the directions to fit the XS pack, the hip belt sits above my hips, around my waist.
When I fit the M/L pack, it is too large overall, with gaps between me and the shoulder straps. I purchased both sizes and had to return both. I will be buying a different brand of pack that fits me properly.
review.name: I would love to give

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worked out great. Feels wonderful, fits everything I needed. Love it.
review.name: Worked out great. Feels wonderful,

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very happy with this purchase! Haven't used it yet but looks like exactly what I need for upcoming backpacking trips. Lots of storage and pockets. Can't wait to use it this summer.
review.name: Very happy with this purchase!

name: Aura AG LT 65L Pack - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Two small gripes: it's a bit tight to insert my foot, but once on, the fit is comfortable, with lots of toe space. The rough coating on the front part is flaking off; a slight aesthetic defect. Otherwise, I am very pleased with the Tevas!
review.name: I'm happy!

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Though I have purchased TEVA for years, I do not recommend this product.
review.name: Returned

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I work in the construction industry and stand on my feet all day so I use hiking boots to aide in my feet being comfortable and dry. These boots are the best. I purchase purchased multiple pairs so I can have comfortable shoes for some time to come. Best hiking shoes I've purchased so far.
review.name: Would buy this shoe again.

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are perfect. They provide lots of support, are comfortable yet not too soft & squishy, are waterproof, and look great. Just what I need for walking through the woods and tramping around town. The Vibram soles have plenty of grip for slippery surfaces and still are easy on my worn out knees. Thanks, Teva.
review.name: Supportive, comfortable, stylish

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a lifestyle trail shoe, not as sturdy as old Wraith III models. This has a knit upper that would not provide support on uneven surface and has little to no structural support from polyester strapping on previous model. Minimal of reinforcement around laces but any ability to secure your foot for handling muddy/slippery surfaces is hopeless.
review.name: I would not recommend

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been using these for construction and hiking. I'm carpenter and have had these for about 2 months. I've probably put what would be 6-8 months of wear for most people on these already. Shoes were a little hard to get on the first couple weeks but after some break in they were fine. I never get blisters on my feet so can't speak to any of the other reviews. I've found the shoes to be comfy from the first time wearing and are still very comfy after all the wear and remain so for a long day of walking, lifting timbers and climbing on framing. I'm getting another pair because I am picky about my shoes and these hit all the marks. Probably light-medium weight, pretty waterproof unless extensively saturated. I have very wide, flat feet. Nice job Teva.
review.name: I'm about to order a second pair

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered both the Ridgeview and Riva boots, tried them both around the house for a few days and decided to go with the Riva's. Ridgeview are ok, but liked the Rivas better. Ridgeview seemed like it would be good on streets and sidewalks but not so much on trails. Both boots have eyelets for the laces and NO hooks, so getting them off and on in unnecessarily difficult, seems like a pretty poor design for no good reason. I ordered both 8.5 and 9, 8.5 is my normal size and was a good fit.
review.name: Returning these

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was in suspect but took the risk and am extremely surprised. It's been my go to boot for lite hiking. Open toe box area for natural forefoot splay yet secure in the heel and arch . Lite weight and good traction.
review.name: Teva boot for hiking ?

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: So bummed about these. Been searching for new hiking boots and hoped Teva would come through, as I have a couple of other pairs of shoes from them and really like them. Sadly these have to go back, as the cons are too much to overcome. Such a near miss. Pros: -Super cushiony insoles -Wider toe box -Nice looking -Seem very Grippy Cons: -Hard to get foot in due to attached tongue - I have narrow feet and I had to really work to get my feet in. My husband tried to get them on and couldn't - he has average sized feet. -They sort of curve in and rub aggressively at the ankles. Blisters guaranteed and I don't think breaking them in would help. Just walking around the house was uncomfortable. -Not breathable - feet were sweaty just wearing them around the house on a cold day, and I'm a cold natured person who doesn't sweat much. Can't imagine a warm day on the trail in these.
review.name: Near miss

review.itemreviewed: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been searching for the perfect hiking boot / shoe for a long time and this is it. Snug in all the right places for my flat feet and light weight. Now to put them to the time test and see how long they hold up.
review.name: Finally found one

name: Ridgeview Mid Ripstop Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love the pullover and the price!  Thank you!!! 😊
review.name: Patagonia zip pullover

review.reviewBody: Better quality than other fleeces I've purchased.  XXXL is bulky loose fit for me but offers a very comfy look and feel. Waste is much looser than the shoulders. XXL is weirdly way smaller than XXL, I do not understand it.  XXL fits but has a snug fit throughout similar to Kuhl but the body/torso is longer (I'm tall so Kuhl eventually gets too short for me); hopefully these Patagonia's won't shrink as bad.
review.name: Happy with Purchase

review.reviewBody:
I never ordered this one so I sent it back.
I ordered the navy one with light blue design and never received it.
Ordered the navy w/light blue sweater 4 times.
Not happy with your service.
review.name: wrong color

review.reviewBody: I'm a big fan of this fleece.  It's warm, stylish and fits great.  I own the royal blue and a green version.  I'm in Texas and it's the perfect level of warmth to throw in your car for the 4 months of the year where its in the 40s- 50's.  I also took it over to London at the beginning of April and found that it was perfect... as long as it wasn't raining, but it is what it is.  It's a little longer and loser than the same version by Arc'teryx, so it can go over more layers if needed.  It's best for around town or by a campfire, it's not the most technical, but it's also not trying to be.   I'm a muscular 5'8" and run 220- 225, I went with the large and it's perfect.
review.name: Great all round fleece

review.reviewBody: My son absolutely loves his Patagonia 1/4” zip sweater. It’s very casual or can be worn to a dress up function. Very comfortable.
review.name: Great Sweater!!

review.reviewBody:
With Spring peeping around the corner I felt the need to buy a sweater which can bridge the gap between early Spring and early Summer as I hike and camp in the great Tuscarora Mountains of Pennsylvania. Having purchase Patagonia products for many years I knew I could count on the design and craftsmanship of this solid company. I was not disappointed. This sweater is warm and offers the freedom of movement I need while hiking through some rough forrest country.
The delivery of my sweater was swift and efficient with the marriage of DHL and the USPS system offered by Back Country. Even on a Sunday, your staff got the ball rolling in processing my order. The fit is right on target in a large for my 185 Lb frame.  A win win experience. Thanks gear heads!
review.name: winning with a Patagonia classic

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my husband as a ski mid-layer. It's perfect for below 0-degree frozen weather!
review.name: Very warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Patagonia means quality.  I have four of these.  I use them for layering for skiing, pullover for chilly mornings in the house, impersonating a French mountain guide, very very useful, and very svelte.  I buy these every year as Christmas gifts for the guys in the family.  Piece of advice, shave before wearing, reduces pilling of the fleece around the neck, as fleece and sandpaper don?t mix, apparently.  Fit is true to size, although larger necks (like mine) will find the fit snug, but not a problem.  I give this item my highest recommendation.
review.name: Basic, Bitchen, Bonser

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable sweater! Nice and warm but breathable. Perfect sweater to take out on the trail, out camping, and even a dinner in town after you're done.
review.name: Your significant other will take it

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my son for his birthday. He loves all things purple and the Piton Purple color was perfect.
review.name: great fleece

I'd love to have one of these! However I cannot because you only go up to a 2XL.
Us big guys like to hunt and fish just as much as our smaller framed brothers. 
Please start offering this in big and tall sizes.
review.name: No big and tall

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Duck Loose Insulated Camo Active Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very impressed with this jacket overall. Fits perfect to size, comfortable and high quality. Very pleased

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Duck Loose Insulated Camo Active Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the prior version of this jacket in Real Tree Hardwoods in 2016 and used it to harvest my first turkey. That jacket lasted 7 hunting seasons (spring and fall) and is still usable but the camo is fading so I bought this jacket as a replacement. I used it the first time for deer this fall.

This jacket appears just as durable as my 2016 jacket, but appears to also have water resistance features as an added bonus. With a wool base layer and long sleeve T underneath, the jacket should be ok for a long sit down to 45 degrees.  For colder weather, just add a down vest. This is probably a roomy medium. I'm a true medium (5'10", 160lbs) and the medium in this jacket gives you room to layer, but it's not so big as to let wind come up the waist elastic.

I own quite a bit of hunting clothes from some big name competitors, but Carhartt has always been my favorite go-to. My only suggestion for improvement is for Carhartt to expand the line. Make Yukon Extremes in hunting pattern! Expand the types of camo patterns. Build it and they will come.
review.name: My go-to hunting jacket

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Duck Loose Insulated Camo Active Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great hunting jacket. I wanted an tough outside lawyer to withstand the thicket, block wind and rain, and allow me to wear layers. This is perfect for that purpose. Also, I've read a few reviews about how some do not like how the zipper goes up too high, but that really isn't a problem. In fact, I'm heavy wind or extremely cold weather, I see it as a plus because you can close up more, but if it is uncomfortable just don't zip all the way way up (common sense).
review.name: Solid, warm and functional

name: Rugged Flex Duck Loose Insulated Camo Active Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
2 weeks and still do not know where is the kayak. Tracking is crap. BC doesn’t know if it’s picked up or still in warehouse. Supposed to be delivered today but no one has called me to set up a time. I have to work to pay for this I can’t take off all day for a maybe…
Order everything from anyplace else. Worst ordering and delivery setup I have ever dealt with.
review.name: No communication

review.reviewBody:
Eight years ago we purchased the Venus 11 for my wife and a Tetra 10 for me. We have had the pleasure of Kayaking from NY to Florida and many stops in between. 
At 8 years both kayaks and us remain active and look forward to many more years of fun. Recommend highly  !
review.name: Great purchase !

name: Venus 11 Sit-On-Top Kayak - 2023 - Women's
